IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: United Way of Erie County's mission is to mobilize resources to break the cycle of poverty and improve our community.
IRS990.MissionDesc: United Way of Erie County's mission is to mobilize resources to break the cycle of poverty and improve our community.
IRS990.Desc: Community Schools - This model is a strategy (not a program) for organizing school and community resources around student success. A community school is both a place and set of partnerships that help address health, wellness and the social needs of its students, families and surrounding neighborhood. Schools become centers of the community, open to everyone, all day, every day, evenings and weekends.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Allocations and Community Impact - To achieve our mission of breaking the cycle of poverty and improving our community, we support, fund, and facilitate intentional local partnerships working together under the collective impact model to achieve goals of student success from birth and family stability. Collective impact is a framework to address complex social problems and has five key conditions that produce true collaboration and alignment among the many partner agencies and programs: common agenda, shared measurements, mutually reinforcing activities, continuous communication, and a backbone organization. As part of its Community Impact work, United Way serves as the backbone for our local efforts. 81.98% of this program's expenses were allocated to agencies and programs in 2023.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Imagination Library - Provides a high-quality, age-appropriate book to any child in Erie County under the age of five. Also recruits and trains volunteer Reading Buddies who help parents and caregivers better understand how to read and interact with young children.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: Beneficial int. in assets held by others

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Funds are used to support the charitable and educational purposes of the United Way and its affiliated agencies.

The Agency has adopted the provisions of FASB ASC 740, Income Taxes. FASB ASC 740 prescribes a more-likely-than-not threshold for financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken in a tax return. The Agency records any related interest expense and penalties, if any, as a tax expense. For the periods ended June 30, 2023 and June 30, 2022, there were no unrecognized tax benefits or interest and penalty expense incurred. Tax years that remain subject to examination are years 2019 and forward.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part XI, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Organizations receiving discretionary funding from the United Way of Erie County undergo intensive pre-screening before being awarded funding, including: an application process that includes explanation of the proposed use and results from use of funding; financial review of the organization to gain a level of assurance that the organization follows sound fiscal policies; verification of compliance with the provisions of the Patriot Act; verification of current status as an IRS Code Section 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Organizations are required to provide United Way of Erie County with semi-annual progress reports that show results achieved to date. Organizations are also required to provide United Way of Erie County with a final report at the end of the funding period that shows actual results achieved compared to the proposed results. Organizations receiving donor designated contributions through United Way of Erie County undergo screening prior to the distribution of funding. Such screening includes verification of compliance with the provisions of the Patriot Act and verification of current status as an IRS Code Section 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.

OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: Imagination Library - Provides a high-quality, age-appropriate book to any child in Erie County under the age of five. Also recruits and trains volunteer Reading Buddies who help parents and caregivers better understand how to read and interact with young children.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Agency's members are its corporators who are appointed annually by the Board of Directors. A minimum of 125 representatives of the community are appointed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is first reviewed by the organization's volunteer Audit Committee. Upon the Audit Committee's review the Form 990 is then distributed to the full board of directors. After review by the full board the Form 990 is filed with the Internal Revenue Service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The conflict of interest policy is reviewed annually by officers, directors and key employees at a formal board meeting. The requirement to disclose interests that could give rise to conflicts of interests is emphasized.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: An Executive Compensation and Review Committee meets regularly to review the performance of the Chief Executive Officer, and to review and approve compensation for the Chief Executive Officer and Senior Vice President. This committee is composed of the current board chair, several past board chairs, the current secretary/treasurer, and several other board members. Compensation data from other local United Way organizations of similar size and geographic location are used for comparison purposes. The deliberations and decisions of this committee are contemporaneously documented and certified by the board chair.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization's governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available to the public upon request. In addition, the financial statements are available to download from the organization's website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I Part II Line h
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The following codes and their definitions are used:Program Operating Cost (POC) - a restricted grant made to an agency in support of the costs associated with a specific program that it operates.Donor Designated for General Support (DD) - an unrestricted grant made to an agency at the direction of the donor(s) in support of its general operating costs.
